parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate. It discusses an educational project related to physics teaching in Romanian schools.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is intended to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an educational project, not to influence the outcome of the parliamentary elections.  The content focuses on the positive impact of the "Physics Otherwise" program on education.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of journalism or citizen journalism, aiming to inform the public about a significant educational initiative. It presents factual information and does not contain any overt attempts to sway public opinion towards a particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions related to the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>587200213885590</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, promoting an educational project ("Physics Otherwise"), does not constitute electoral propaganda.  It lacks any direct or indirect reference to parliamentary candidates or parties, and its primary objective is to inform the public about an educational initiative. The content is journalistic in nature, focusing on the positive impact of the project on Romanian education.  The paid nature of the post on a public platform does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda if the content itself is not related to the elections.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Press One Media SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
